intro: Bouteloua barbata var. sonorae, commonly known as the Sonoran dropseed, is a grass species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flower clusters that appear in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. This variety is often used in native plant landscaping due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
